text.section: A Board of Directors shall manage the Center and exercise its corporate powers.

The Board consists of the following nine members:
the Director, or the Director's designee; and
eight members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate:
two representing the not-for-profit clean energy research sector of the State;
two with expertise in venture capital financing;
two representing clean energy industries in the State; and
two members of the general public.
A member of the Board shall reside in the State.

In making appointments to the Board, the Governor shall consider:
diversity; and
all geographic regions of the State.

A member of the Board:
may not receive compensation as a member of the Board; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.

section.section: The term of an appointed member is 4 years and begins on July 1.
The terms of the appointed members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members on October 1, 2008.
At the end of a term, an appointed member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove an appointed member for incompetence, misconduct, or failure to perform the duties of the position.
